column4: Is there a way to restart X from a tty without having to close all of my running programs?
No.
run sudo blkid -g; sudo blkid
What happened to it?
not a clue, last night it worked and today only the ntfs partitions are still alive.
still doesn't find the partition.
Then pastebin the output of sudo blkid please
And which partition is missing from your point of view?
gparted claims that sdc6 is unknown file system of 101G last night it was ext4.
Then pastebin sudo fdisk -l /dev/sdc please
So what have you done then? :)
I have no clue, at the worste I unplugged it w/out ejecting the device.
oh, I turned off the computer with the device plugged in and then unplugged it.
That wont change the partitioning scheme.
And it was ext4 yesterday?
sdc6 was ext4 yesterday?
it could have been sdc4
No.
Powering off NEVER changes the partitioning scheme.
I used fsck.ext4 on /dev/sdc6 and it seems to have repair something, right now it is checking for bad sectors though.
